intro: Tillaea pentandra, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and rocky environments in the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Tillaea pentandra is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soils in harsh landscapes.
